item.title: Johannesburg
item.description: Exploring Johannesburg: A Memorable Adventure Stepping foot in Johannesburg after a grueling 20-hour journey, I knew I was in for an exciting and challenging experience. My first task was to secure a reliable internet connection at the airport, enabling me to book an Uber or Bolt ride to my hostel. Although it took more than an hour to get the Wi-Fi working, I finally succeeded. Little did I know that another hurdle awaited me just outside the secure area where families and friends typically gather.

item.title: Kruger
item.description: Exploring the Wildlife in Kruger (30.05) Our journey began with Juan’s booking of an early morning driving tour with a knowledgeable guide for a mere $20. The irresistible deal prompted us to join him on this adventure. Riding in a classic safari jeep with seats in the back, we embarked on an exhilarating tour through Kruger National Park. The diverse wildlife we encountered left us in awe - graceful giraffes, majestic elephants, colorful birds, graceful antelopes, playful zebras, and even a few curious chickens.

item.title: First post
item.description: The first little post Welcome, dear reader! It’s great to have you here on my brand new webpage. If you’re interested in learning more about me, please feel free to check out the About Me section. I’m still new to building websites, so there maybe some issues here and there. This website was built using Hugo, which is a static webpage tool that heavily utilizes markdown. That’s all for now, but if you need to contact me, the best way to reach me is through email.

About Wow, a whole page about me ;D Why this website? I always have the idea to start technical projects. Often these are not fully implemented or get stuck somewhere. I have tried to build and publish a website myself before. Now that I am going to make a trip to the south of Africa after my studies, I had the idea to create a website for family, friends and as an external effect, where I can share my trip.
